about_the_game:
• Randomized course layout for each session. Golfing In Aether accomplishes this through having each of the holes being its own independent floating island. There are currently more than 40 holes excluding variations in the game. The game will choose these at random from a pool at the start of a session and procedurally create the overall course layout.
  • Get-together with friends in sessions supporting up to 16 players online. Local multiplayer allows you to have either 4 players, each with their own controller, or have up to 8 when taking in turns using a shared input pass-the-controller mode. You can take any additional local players into online sessions with you.
  • Freedom to choose different modes such as playing together in real time (local players use split screen) or taking it in turns via hotseat. Online sessions also support joining as a spectator.
  • Cross-platform multiplayer so you can play with your friends whether you are on Windows or Linux.
  • Compete against ghosts in practice mode for the top spot in an individual level with both global and friends only leaderboards.
  • Replay your previous sessions via the session replays feature. This allows you to spectate previous sessions you've played with options such as being able to see from another players perspective, use free camera, and the ability manipulate playback rate.
  • Customize through a range of color-pickable designs for your golf ball. Five designs are available from the start with others being unlocked as you earn XP through playing and level up.
  • Accessible with full gamepad support through the inclusion of an on-screen keyboard and ability to create local player profiles for saving any customizations, player names or gamepad settings.
detailed_description:
• Randomized course layout for each session. Golfing In Aether accomplishes this through having each of the holes being its own independent floating island. There are currently more than 40 holes excluding variations in the game. The game will choose these at random from a pool at the start of a session and procedurally create the overall course layout.
  • Get-together with friends in sessions supporting up to 16 players online. Local multiplayer allows you to have either 4 players, each with their own controller, or have up to 8 when taking in turns using a shared input pass-the-controller mode. You can take any additional local players into online sessions with you.
  • Freedom to choose different modes such as playing together in real time (local players use split screen) or taking it in turns via hotseat. Online sessions also support joining as a spectator.
  • Cross-platform multiplayer so you can play with your friends whether you are on Windows or Linux.
  • Compete against ghosts in practice mode for the top spot in an individual level with both global and friends only leaderboards.
  • Replay your previous sessions via the session replays feature. This allows you to spectate previous sessions you've played with options such as being able to see from another players perspective, use free camera, and the ability manipulate playback rate.
  • Customize through a range of color-pickable designs for your golf ball. Five designs are available from the start with others being unlocked as you earn XP through playing and level up.
  • Accessible with full gamepad support through the inclusion of an on-screen keyboard and ability to create local player profiles for saving any customizations, player names or gamepad settings.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Ubuntu 20.04 (64-bit required)
  • Processor: 2.4 GHz Dual-Core 64-bit CPU
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce® 700 Series (Maxwell) / AMD Radeon™ RX 400 Series / AMD Ryzen™ Processors with Radeon™ Vega Graphics
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1080p/60fps when graphics settings are set to "Medium".
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Ubuntu 22.04 (64-bit required)
  • Processor: 3 GHz Quad-Core 64-bit CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce® GTX 1650 / AMD Radeon™ RX 570
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1080p/60fps when graphics settings are set to "Highest".

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: macOS Sequoia 15
  • Processor: Apple M1 or Similar Intel (Universal Binary)
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: macOS Sequoia 15
  • Processor: Apple M2+
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

name: Golfing in Aether Demo

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows® 7, 8, 8.1, 10, 11 (64-bit required)
  • Processor: 2.4 GHz Dual-Core 64-bit CPU
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce® 700 Series (Maxwell) / AMD Radeon™ RX 400 Series / AMD Ryzen™ Processors with Radeon™ Vega Graphics
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1080p/60fps when graphics settings are set to "Medium"
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows® 10, 11 (64-bit required)
  • Processor: 3 GHz Quad-Core 64-bit CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce® GTX 1650 / AMD Radeon™ RX 570
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1080p/60fps when graphics settings are set to "Highest".

short_description: Minigolf for up to 16 players online, or 4 players via split screen. Features randomized course layout allowing you to experience something different every time you play.
supported_languages:
English*, Japanese*, French*, German*, Spanish - Spain*, Portuguese - Brazil*, Portuguese - Portugal*, Spanish - Latin America*
*languages with full audio support
